result.execSummary:
The defendant Lamont Franklin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting An Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Sign up for probation no later than 8/5/2022 by 5:00 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Submit a DNA sample by 8/5/2022 and pay the surcharge during probation. Failure to pay ill result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lamont Franklin

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lamont Franklin in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 0 days time served. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 9 months with the following conditions:

- Sign up for probation no later than 8/5/2022 by 5:00 pm.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- No prescription drugs without a valid prescription
- Obtain/maintain full time work.
- Complete 16 hours of community service.
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
- Submit a DNA sample by 8/5/2022 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.

Defendant Lamont Franklin in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing held via zoom. Status conference held. Parties have reached a resolution and are requesting a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 01.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Lamont Franklin in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status. Defense in need of an offer and requests an adjournment.
Court orders Defendant re-establish contact with Justice Point and that all previously ordered conditions remain. Case adjourned back to Br 01.  Status conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Violation Report 06-14-2022, filed.  rmm

Attorney Patrick Wait in court, defendant Lamont Franklin not in court, in custody.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Pretrial conference held.  Atty Wait requests a status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Lamont Franklin in court with attorney Kylie Kaltenberg.  Defendant Lamont Franklin in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lamont Franklin appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
